Size: Up to 2 m high, climbing to 5 m.
Leaves: Glossy green upper surface, 1-6 cm long.
Flowers: Small clusters of blue or pink-white, with 5 petals drooping in bell shape.
FruitSeeds: Small, fleshy, oval shaped to 2 cm, ripening from green to blueish-purple, with more than 50 seeds.
DistinguishingFeatures: Several close lookalikes in native range in WA, outside of native range only hybrid Billardiera are similar.
